alert.note: Alert for Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Thomas County through 845 PM CDT... At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Levant, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Accumulating small hail may be occuring with this storm. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Thomas County. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 39 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
